issue.title: [CI/Docker/Python] Support running integration tests on multiple python versions
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3737](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3737). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently python-3.6 image is pinned in integration/hdfs/Dockerfile and integration/pandas-master/Dockerfile. It's possible to pass build time argument similarly like the arrow:python-${PYTHON_VERSION} image works.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3737?focusedCommentId=16763265) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Does this actually matter? Python is an incidental detail of running the integration tests

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3737?focusedCommentId=16932342) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Indeed, this doesn't seem useful.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3737?focusedCommentId=17585993) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
